message.content:
cs.DC, cs.AR, cs.SE, cs.SY, cs.PL

The paper discusses the management of resilience in extreme-scale HPC systems, which involves handling various hardware and software technologies to deal with faults, errors, and failures. This suggests that the paper may belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category, which deals with the design, analysis, and implementation of distributed systems, parallel computing, and cluster computing. 

The paper also mentions the use of innovative architectures and software environments, which may fall under the sub-categories of Architecture (cs.AR) and Software Engineering (cs.SE), respectively. 

Furthermore, the paper discusses the need for a framework to optimize the cost-benefit trade-offs among performance, resilience, and power consumption, which may fall under the sub-category of Systems and Control (cs.SY). 

Finally, the paper proposes the use of design patterns to address commonly occurring problems in the design of resilient systems, which may fall under the sub-category of Programming Languages (cs.PL), which deals with the design and implementation of programming languages and software systems.
